title: Letterhead, Illinois Powder Manufacturing Company, late 20th century
medium: Letterpress: black, red and gold ink on off white wove paper
markings: Watermark: Strathmore Highway Bond / Rag Content USA
inscribed: Imprinted below Company name: INCORPORATED / 1907. Address in black below logo: 1752 PIERCE BUILDING / ST. LOUIS, MO.
description: Company name in raised black ink within thin black borders, underlined in red. The gold and red circular logo at upper right is joined to three small red, white and black diamonds at upper right by an s-shaped scroll ending in foliage. The logo is a red and gold box labeled 'explosives' surrounded by text reading "Gold Medal Explosives" in a circular starburst.

tombstone.epitaph:
Letterhead, Illinois Powder Manufacturing Company, late 20th century. Letterpress: black, red and gold ink on off white wove paper. 
Gift of Thomas F. O'Malley. 1999-59-12
